sn2.name: SN2 Reaction
sn2.mechanism: The nucleophile attacks the carbon from the backside, causing the leaving group to depart simultaneously. This results in inversion of stereochemistry (Walden inversion).
steps: Bond formation and bond breaking occur simultaneously
factors: Steric hindrance around the carbon center

sn1.name: SN1 Reaction
sn1.mechanism: The leaving group departs first to form a carbocation intermediate, which is then attacked by the nucleophile.
steps: Leaving group departs to form carbocation

e2.name: E2 Reaction
e2.mechanism: A base removes a proton while the leaving group departs simultaneously, forming a double bond.
